abstract: A private investigator accused of posing as a journalist to read the reporter’s private phone records as part of the boardroom spying scandal at Hewlett-Packard was charged Wednesday with federal identity theft and conspiracy charges. The investigator, Bryan Wagner, is accused of using the Social Security number of the unidentified journalist to gain access illegally to the phone logs, according to the criminal charges filed by a United States attorney, Kevin V. Ryan, in Federal District Court in San Jose, Calif.
lead_paragraph: A private investigator accused of posing as a journalist to read the reporter’s private phone records as part of the boardroom spying scandal at Hewlett-Packard was charged Wednesday with federal identity theft and conspiracy charges. The investigator, Bryan Wagner, is accused of using the Social Security number of the unidentified journalist to gain access illegally to the phone logs, according to the criminal charges filed by a United States attorney, Kevin V. Ryan, in Federal District Court in San Jose, Calif.

headline.main: Identity Theft Charge in H.P. Spying Case
